statement.tex: \text{The two adjacent sides of a parallelogram are} \\ \vector{2}{-4}{5}\text{ and }\vector{1}{-2}{-3}. \text{ Find the unit} \\ \text{vector parallel to its diagonal. Also, find the} \\ \text{area of the parallelogram.}

step.context: \text{If }\ora{AD}=\vector{3}{-6}{2}, \text{then is a unit vector} \\ \text{in its direction given by the following?}

step.reason: \text{Area is a scalar and as such does not have a} \\ \text{directional component. When computing area} \\ \text{of a parallelogram based on the adjacent side} \\ \text{vectors, we must compute it as the{\bf magnitude}} \\ \text{of the cross product of the two vectors.} \\ \therefore {\bf \text{Area}=\vert \ora{AB}\times \ora{AC}\vert}
